      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        Gets the current count to check it against if statements in the controller These if statements trigger buttons/textfields changing/becoming visible
        Returns:
        count integer which is a counter
        Since:
        1.2

      • getNonConvCount

        public int getNonConvCount()
        Same as counter however it increments to show how the parameter gets further away from the base case
        Returns:
        nonConvcount integer which is a counter
        Since:
        1.2

      • setNonConvCount

        public void setNonConvCount(int n)
        Same as counter however it increments to show how the parameter gets further away from the base case
        Since:
        1.2

      • setAfterReturnText

        public void setAfterReturnText()
        This is triggered at the "return statement" i.e when the final return value has been input by the user This hides all the other text and text boxes while adding a new one to tell the user what to do If the text boxes are not hidden, some errors will be thrown if the user were to focus and unfocus the text boxes
        Since:
        1.2

      • setTxtArea

        public void setTxtArea()
        Sets the value of the text area. Fills it with the arraylist, replacing "[", "]" and "," with nothing so it looks better
        Since:
        1.2

      • addArrayString

        public void addArrayString()
        Adds a string to the arraylist each time it is called. For one time only, the first line is set at count+1 as its the original parameter and we only want to add this one time After that, a new string is added each time. The count decrements so acts as the value of n decreasing with each recursive call. The if statement of count being greater than 0 stops it printing one line too many on the last submit button
        Since:
        1.2

      • addQuestion

        public void addQuestion()
        Adds the multiple choice question and hides the parameter question

      • questionAnswered

        public boolean questionAnswered()
        Checks the user has selected a radio button as an answer Returns true if one of the radio buttons are selected Returns false if none are selected
        Returns:
        a boolean true or false

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Action performed listener for radio buttons It sets the return value depending on which button the user selected
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • setFocus

        public void setFocus()
        Sets the focus on the txtNVal text field once an answer has been submitted. This prevents the user from having to constantly click the text field over and over to insert input
